title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
Apple reported quarterly results that showed how supply-chain difficulties are tripping up even some of the biggest business winners of the pandemic era.

Amazon posted lower-than-expected third-quarter sales and signaled that a tight labor market and supply-chain disruptions would weigh on earnings.

Shell's CEO defended the energy giant's business model, setting up a showdown with activist investor Third Point, which has called for a breakup of the company.

The S&P 500 and Nasdaq gained 1% and 1.4%, respectively, to close Thursday's session at records. The Dow industrials rose 0.7%.

China Evergrande avoided default for a second time by making an overdue interest payment on dollar bonds shortly before the end of a 30-day grace period.

T. Rowe Price agreed to buy Oak Hill Advisors for as much as $4.2 billion to enter the private-debt investing business.

What's News: Business & Finance
